biografia:
William Leslie Thomson
's father was  Thomas Thomson
(
born in Lauder, Berwick about
1843)
who was a butcher. His mother was  Margaret Thomson
(
born Edinburgh about
1843)
. He had several younger siblings: Margaret
(
born about
1870)
, Beatrice
(
born about
1872)
, Thomas
(
born about
1874)
, James
(
born about
1877)
, Isabella
(
born about
1879)
and Robert
(
born about
1880)
.
William Thomson attended school in Penicuik, then at St Andrew's School, Perth. After training at the Church of Scotland Training College in Edinburgh, he entered the University of Edinburgh to study mathematics and physics, graduating in
1891
. He then was awarded a scholarship to allow him to study mathematics at Caius College, Cambridge. He was a
Wrangler
in the Mathematical Tripos of
1894
.
He married Jessie Thomson. Their daughter Lizzie was born about
1898
.
Thomson became a school teacher, teaching mathematics first in in Kirkwall, then at Kilmarnock Academy. In
1899
J W Butters
left George Heriot's School in Edinburgh to become Rector at the Academy in Ardrossan. Thomson was appointed to George Heriot's School to fill the vacancy and he taught there until he retired in
1928
.
